meanings.definition: An official order issued by a legal authority.
meanings.sent1: The king's decree commanded all citizens to wear masks in public.
meanings.sent2: The judge issued a decree for the immediate arrest of the suspect.
meanings.sent3: The decree to only eat vegetables on Fridays made the townspeople chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Her decree to ban all sugary snacks was met with resistance from the children.
meanings.sent5: The decree to evacuate the area before the storm hit was a life-saving decision.

meanings.definition: To order or decide something officially.
meanings.sent1: The principal will decree a new rule regarding cell phone usage in school.
meanings.sent2: The president decreed a national holiday to celebrate the country's independence.
meanings.sent3: She decreed that all meetings must start with a dance party.
meanings.sent4: The coach decreed that all players must wear mismatched socks for good luck.
meanings.sent5: The teacher decreed a surprise quiz to test the students' knowledge.

meanings.sent1: The committee's decree to cancel the event disappointed many attendees.
meanings.sent2: The company's decree to implement a new dress code was met with mixed reactions.
meanings.sent3: His decree to only communicate through interpretive dance raised eyebrows.
meanings.sent4: The queen's decree to lower taxes brought relief to the struggling citizens.
meanings.sent5: The council's decree to plant more trees in the city was a step towards environmental conservation.
